025 |longm= 46.5 |longs= |elevation_m = |postal_code = |website = [http://www.kiiminki.fi/ www.kiiminki.fi] |footnotes = }} '''Kiiminki''' ({{lang-sv|Kiminge}}) was a [[municipalities of Finland|municipality]] of [[Finland]]. Along with [[Haukipudas]], [[Oulunsalo]] and [[Yli-Ii]] municipalities it was merged with the city of [[Oulu]] on 1 January 2013. Kiiminki municipality was part of the [[Oulu (province)|Oulu]] [[provinces of Finland|province]] in the [[Northern Ostrobothnia]] [[regions of Finland|region]]. The municipality had a population of {{formatnum: {{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population count|Kiiminki}}}} ({{#time: j F Y|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population count|sourcedate}} }})<ref name="population_count" /> and covered an area of {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/total area|Kiiminki}}|km2}} of which {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/land area|Kiiminki}}|km2|abbr=on}} is water.<ref name="total_area" /> The [[population density]] is {{convert|{{Infobox Finnish Municipality/population density|Kiiminki|round=2}}|PD/km2}}. The municipality was unilingually [[Finnish language|Finnish]]. == Buildings and structures == There is a 326-metre tall guyed mast for FM- and TV broadcasting. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Kiiminki}} *[http://www.kiiminki.fi/en Municipality of Kiiminki] â€“ Official website {{NorthernOstrobothnia}} [[Category:Municipalities of Northern Ostrobothnia Region]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1867]] {{OuluProvince-geo-stub}}
